attributes.action: Please protect our heather moorland
attributes.background: Please recognise our heather moorland as sites of national importance giving them national heritage status .
attributes.additional_details: We have a big responsibility to look after our heather moorland and all the wildlife and biodiversity that depends on it. Heather moors are a haven for many types of wildlife  you might see a curlew, black grouse, ring ouzel, field vole, merlin, short-eared owl, adder a red grouse. We have a duty to protect all habitats and not to lose some that seem less important than others . They are visually beautiful particularly in August when the heather blooms . They are under threat and will be sadly missed if they are not allowed to be managed and conserved .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about protection for heather moorlands, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. There are number of protections that already apply to areas of the countryside, and establishing additional protections are largely a matter for local authorities and other authorities responsible for areas of the countryside.

You can find out more about protected areas of the countryside here: https://www.gov.uk/check-your-business-protected-area

If there are specific changes you want to be made to the framework for how areas of the countryside are protected, you could start a new petition, but would need to explain clearly what changes you would like the Government or Parliament to make to existing rules.

attributes.action: Protect productive agricultural land and green belt from development in law
attributes.background: Bring in legal protection for  productive agricultural  and green belt land from development.
attributes.additional_details:
We need our prime agricultural land to grow sustainable high quality food which will cut our carbon foot print.  The soil where the crops are growing locks in carbon so is a big part of the fight against the Climate Emergency. The fields also provide habitats and hunting grounds for wildlife.
Green spaces provide a home for biodiversity to thrive also part of the solution to the Climate Crisis. They are also vital for people's health and well being.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about development of greenbelt land, however it's not clear what legal protections you want to be introduced to protect such land. 

If there is a specific legal protection you would like to be brought in, you could start a petition about that.

You may like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Create environmental laws for UK supermarkets
attributes.background: We need supermarkets to act faster on sustainability. Supermarkets need to stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets have the power to change consumers’ habits and stop offering us produce that are destroying nature. We need to consume less but we need supermarkets to help drive that change and not offer us produce out of season from half way round the world. We also need to reduce waste and start conserving our planet’s resources. But we need to do it now.

rejection.details:
You want supermarkets to "stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce" but it is not clear how this would be assessed, or what would be classed as 'sustainable produce'.

You may wish to sign the following petitions which relate to similar issues:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320082

attributes.action: Ban neonicotinoid thiamethoxam (toxic to bees) to treat sugar beet seed.
attributes.background: Debate the use of this toxic pesticide which will reduce the bee population; the bee population is already being decimated. Bees are crucial for pollination and are key part of food webs and biodiversity. They are ‘the canary in the coal mine', they tell us about the health of the wider environment.
attributes.additional_details: The Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations clearly states bees are vital to our food production and eco systems: http://www.fao.org/3/i9527en/i9527en.pdf

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: The Government should to its commitment on Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The Government should keep to its commitment to spending 0.7% of GDP on Foreign Aid.
attributes.additional_details: The new Foreign Office permanent secretary, Sir Philip Barton, appearing at the foreign affairs select committee two weeks ago, provided no details on this year’s near £2.9bn cuts to aid, but said the department’s priorities were Covid health requirements, girls’ education, climate change and biodiversity, the “bottom billion” poorest people and defending open societies, human rights and “force-for-good” programming.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561068

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory sustainability indicators on food and product packaging
attributes.background: Due to increased pressures regarding biodiversity decline and loss of natural habitats, the government should pass law that supermarkets and product manufacturers display how sustainable their products are on the packaging. This could be in the form of an additional traffic light style guide.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless we act fast and educate the general public in an accessible and digestible way, we're going to run out of time and see the collapse of the natural living world. Such a small change to how food and consumer products are presented could have a dramatic, positive impact to consumer behaviour. 

Not only would the additional indicators hugely benefit our environment, they'd be likely to have positive economic impacts due to local UK products being favourable over unsustainable import goods.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844

attributes.action: Reintroduce wolves into the UK
attributes.background: We want the government to discuss reintroducing wolves into rural areas of the UK. Wolves should be integrated into our ecosystem.
attributes.additional_details: The establishment of wolves has a beneficial impact on our environment. Wolves are a keystone species scientifically proven to boost biodiversity diversity and carbon sequestration. They help to regulate deer populations naturally. Wild ungulates tend to be the preferred prey of wolves over livestock.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about releasing wolves in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland are a matter for the Scottish, Welsh and Northern Ireland governments, not the UK Government or Parliament. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to reintroduce wolves to England.

attributes.action: Ban Fracking in Lancashire (and Nationwide)
attributes.background: To vote against fracking in the UK to uphold our country's commitment to the global fight against climate change and prevent the environmental disasters caused by fracking in other countries from occurring in our country; preserving our beautiful rural areas, its wilderness and biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier in Liz Truss's premiership she stated that fracking would go ahead in areas as long as there is local support; as a constituent of Blackpool I can categorically state that there has already been passionate resistance to previous attempts to frack in the area. Fracking cause tremors which are a threat to peoples houses and livelihoods as seen elsewhere in the world, furthermore, fracking also disrupts and displaces wildlife due to noise pollution and the destruction of natural habitats.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

attributes.action: Ban use of all non biodegradable virgin plastics for packaging by 2023
attributes.background:
In a bid to reduce plastic waste, France is banning plastic packaging for nearly all fruit and vegetables from January 2022, the environment ministry has announced.

The UK should be doing the same.
attributes.additional_details:
Biologists, scientists and doctors have made us all aware of the vast damage virgin plastic non-biodegradable packaging is causing. 

We believe that it is vital the government bans production of the petrochemical based virgin plastics to prevent furthering the  catastrophic effects they are causing.

 Our natural marine life and land biodiversity is at huge risk.

Micro plastics are causing serious health risks to our lives.

There are many alternatives for packaging.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

attributes.action: Stop developers building  on areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONB)
attributes.background: Legislate so when a council has no 5 year housing plan, planning approval can not be given where development is in an AONB. This “loophole” needs to be fixed. Brown field sites need to be prioritised and existing planning approvals need to be developed before applications can be considered on AONB
attributes.additional_details: Ensure that areas of outstanding natural beauty are duly protect to create a legacy for future generations to enjoy our countryside, ensure sustainable biodiversity and environmental protection. When for whatever reason a council has no up to date housing development plan developers are exploiting this condition and time and obtaining approval for development on areas of outstanding natural beauty. Putting greed before seed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development in Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB), but we're not sure if you want all development in these areas to be banned, or just development when the local authority does not have a 5-year housing plan in place.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Subject all mature trees to Tree Preservation Orders.
attributes.background: We need protection of all mature trees, as afforded to those in conservation areas, ensured in response to the Government declared Climate Emergency 1st May 2019. Mature trees are being removed without environmentally commensurate replacement, and with the life sustained by the tree already lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Trees store carbon and give us oxygen, vital for life. 
They provide habitat for wildlife and support biodiversity. 
In urban areas they reduce noise and capture pollutants from the air we breathe. They provide soil stability and reduce stormwater runoff, crucial for flood management. Trees provide shelter from wind and sun, and actively cool the surrounding air as well as enhancing our lives, giving us a sense of beauty and well being.

The right time to plant a tree is many decades ago.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300050

attributes.action: Stop the planting of non-native tree, shrub, and flowers on new housing estates.
attributes.background: Government should restrict the purchase & planting by new housing developments & home owners of non-native plants, trees & shrubs on highways, property & open spaces. In order to achieve net gains for biodiversity, native species such as bees and hedgehogs, would benefit by planting native flora.
attributes.additional_details: This will be essential in urban spaces, to provide key habitat for native fauna, assist in gains for biodiversity in the uk and more importantly, carbon drawdown. There will also be less management involved in maintaining natural, self sustaining trees and shrubs, which grow better to the uk climate, soils and do not create dead areas of vegetation build up, crowded and overgrown areas which require maintenance and are unsuitable for British fauna. This is fundamental to British biodiversity.

rejection.details: It is up to private housing developers and homeowners, rather than the Government or Parliament, to decide what kinds of plants they grow. You could start a petition asking the Government to dedicate a fund for local councils to grow native plants and increase native biodiversity.

attributes.action: Allow communities to use beavers for flood management and increase biodiversity
attributes.background: The River Otter Beaver trial in Devon has proven beyond doubt the benefits of reintroducing beavers. Not only do they help with flood prevention, beavers increase biodiversity by creating new habitats for plants and animals, offer tourism opportunities, store carbon and clean water, at very low cost
attributes.additional_details: I am a parish councillor at Braunton, North Devon and I would like to reintroduce beavers to the River Caen catchment to help reduce flooding, increase biodiversity, create tourist and academic opportunities, store carbon, and clean river water to encourage migratory fish. Current legislation will not allow this to happen. I think beavers represent a huge opportunity to use the greatest water engineers on the planet to help solve flooding, and biodiversity loss, caused by climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about current restrictions on the release of beavers, but we're not sure if you want the Government to remove all legal restrictions on the release of beavers, or to allow local authorities to release beavers for the purpose of flood management without needing to obtain a licence, or something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make house building companies accountable for the land they own.
attributes.background: Land on new build housing estates is usually turfed or has minimal landscaping that is not conducive to ecological best practices. Open public areas and other landscaped areas should be designed for communal human use alongside ecological use to rewild land and improve biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details: Many new build estates have large open areas of lawn and other poorly designed gardens that could be much better used to engage people and improve the environment. I propose a rethink in the way that spaces are used and designed. Rather than continuing to use monoculture and planting areas of little ecological value, principles of rewilding, permaculture and mycology can be bought into an urban design setting to improve the land over time rather than continue the trend of nutrient removal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as a change to planning rules.

attributes.action: Establish mandatory buffer zones of a minimum of 10 metres,next to watercourses.
attributes.background: Our rivers and streams are part of our National Infrastructure. River and stream margins protect our rivers and streams, store water, clean water, provide important habitat for our wildlife and store carbon. Many of our margins are lost through agriculture and development.
attributes.additional_details:
Development on floodplains is a prime cause of catastrophic flooding.
Soil erosion from fields cost the taxpayer £150million per year (Cranfield University 2009) Margins stop the soil leaving the fields.
The mandatory buffer zones will reduce the run-off into rivers of pesticides and fertilisers used in agriculture.
 Wilder river and stream corridors created through mandatory buffer zones  will reduce flooding, reduce pollution, capture carbon, help biodiversity, help business and help people

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development near watercourses, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "buffer zones", but doesn't say what these should involve.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Allow the sale of clean energy Electrofuel & Biomethane cars as soon as possible
attributes.background: The Government must allow the sale of cars that run on clean energy fuels for example, Electrofuels / Efuels & Biomethane to reduce or even reverse CO2 levels. These cars should be allowed to be sold in order to reduce dependence on Lithium the extraction of which is very damaging to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Liquid fuels will use a normal fuel pump, with no need for environmentally damaging changes to roads everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates higher co2 emissions, are expensive and will need to be replaced after only a few years.
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle thereby reducing carbon levels.
Biomethane is more biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
Combustion engine cars are more affordable for those on a lower income.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see more cars running on clean energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Cars that use clean fuels, including non-fossil methane, are already allowed to operate in the UK. You can find out more about what fuels can be used in road vehicles here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/fuels-for-use-in-vehicles-excise-notice-75

attributes.action: Maintain the ban on known bee-killing pesticides (neonicotinoids) in the U.K.
attributes.background: The U.K. government explicitly promised that in the wake of Brexit that they would maintain the EU ban on pesticides (neonicotinoids) known to kill bees. We’re meagre weeks into January and this promise has already been broken. Please revoke this decision and ban these pesticides.
attributes.additional_details:
British insects and pollinators are already in a terrible condition due to habitat loss and pesticide use. Pollinators are a vital keystone species and should be protected for both biodiversity and their enormous economic value to the British £100billion food industry. Use of these pesticides can also adversely impact wildflowers, birds, mammals and aquatic invertebrates. 
This decision is environmentally regressive and bordering on offensive as we were explicitly promised this wouldn’t happen.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Adapt Water Protection Laws to what they were Pre-Brexit
attributes.background: In recent years, after Brexit, Water Pollution has massively increased within river systems within England, as they have repealed most of the Water Protection laws that were EU laws. In order to have a government that cares for the people, we need our water systems to be safe from pollutants.
attributes.additional_details: Water Pollution has been scientifically proven to have adverse and damaging effects on the natural local biodiversity of environments across river basins and a dramatic effect on human health for those residing in river basins which are affected by Water Pollution. With the government's help in reinstating European Union water protection laws, we can ensure that the British Public has access to clean and safe rivers without the risk of chemical, thermal and environmentally damaging pollution

rejection.details:
It is not the case that most EU laws relating to water have been repealed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: Create law that front gardens must comprise of plants
attributes.background: We need a law to protect front gardens from being completely obliterated with man-made materials, ensuring that there are plants in every single one for wildlife. At least one-third of all front gardens should be comprised of plants, be that grass, flowers, shrubs or trees.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there are no laws on how much of a front garden can be left for nature with many now being tarmacked or slabbed over, resulting in less space for wildlife and so diminishing biodiversity. In order to limit global temperature warming and increase insect populations, we need to be utilising this vital space of the front garden to take it back to what it should be - a front garden. We need more plants and trees to act as carbon stores, and more flowers for pollinators.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how to maintain domestic gardens are a matter for the homeowner, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Establish Cabinet Office Briefing Rooms (COBR) for the climate emergency.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has been a global leader in the past and we have the opportunity to show real leadership to tackle the climate change crisis, biodiversity loss and pollution of nature and the impacts on or own health and well being.  We need emergency action and planning establishing COBR.
attributes.additional_details: The government has declared a climate emergency and the science is screaming at us we have to change now, as an emergency. COP 26 has just about kept "1.5" alive, but we need action. COBR is required to bring the planners, military strategists, business, individuals, innovators, and government together to set the plan to tackle the crisis and tell the world we are acting post COP 26 and listening to the public. Committees are not the answer for an emergency, we need action right now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Government action on climate change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

COBR (or COBRA) is shorthand for the Civil Contingencies Committee that is convened to handle matters of national emergency or major disruption, and the briefing rooms referred to in the acronym are located in Whitehall.

There are already Cabinet Committees on Climate Action Strategy and Climate Action Implementation, but we could accept a petition calling on the Government to schedule COBR meetings to address the climate emergency, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Put more effort into improving biodiversity in the uk
attributes.background: Make more parks and wildlife reserves available and protect existing ones.
attributes.additional_details: If they don't do this then Co2 emissions will increase in the atmosphere and will contribute to the greenhouse effect and will increase health problems.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as funding local councils to create more green spaces.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all inhumane glue traps in the UK
attributes.background: To prevent the suffering of harmless insects, and to ensure the biodiversity of our natural environments, I am campaigning to ban all glue traps in the UK. These include pheromone traps, wardrobe glue traps (for harmless clothes moths), fly strips and ant traps.
attributes.additional_details: Glue traps are a commonly used, inhumane, and cruel method of repelling insects such as moth and flies. Tree glue traps, pheromone traps, and fly strips are just a few of these abominable methods of repelling insects, and all cause long, slow deaths for the poor creatures that succumb to them. The traps are also reducing biodiversity within our natural environments, by removing reliable food sources for creatures like owls, birds and bats.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560288

attributes.action: 'The Economics of Biodiversity: The Dasgupta review' - please act
attributes.background: We call on the government to act urgently on the recommendations in the paper: 'The Economics of Biodiversity: The Dasgupta review', which was issued in February 2021 by the UK Treasury department.  Quote from p489 - "we need also to change our production and consumption patterns"
attributes.additional_details:
The Dasgupta Biodiversity Review shows us a way forward to address the accelerating ecological collapse in our environment.    We need an awareness campaign for institutions to transition their thinking as recommended in this review.  The government need to show leadership to the rest of the world on this issue.  The existential threat from global ecological overshoot is growing daily and our contribution to this global problem is significant.  

https://www.cam.ac.uk/stories/dasguptareview

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
                
You'll need to set out exactly what changes or recommendations you'd like to be implemented.

attributes.action: Investigate funding priorities by Swansea Council for SUP scheme
attributes.background:
Request Swansea Council to:
Cease work on SUP in ancient heritage Clyne Woodland 
Complete a Health & Safety risk assessment for users
Consult with stakeholders/local community & daily users
Complete an environmental impact assessment
Stop the closure of woodland public access during a pandemic
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure:
1. Active Travel Funds are allocated in the best interests of all users. There are already extensive designated woodland cycle routes (NCN4) for road/trail bike users. 
2. Required consultation with the community*
3. Safety of all users** 
*Ch 6 & Ch 11, ** Ch 12 Welsh Government Active Travel Guidance 2020
To protect:
1. Biodiversity of ancient woodland
2. Heritage & artefacts of Clyne Valley

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Allow the sale of cars running on cleaner fuel like E85 & renewable Biomethane
attributes.background: The government should allow the sale and future development of cars that run on cleaner fuels such as E12 up to E85, and renewable Biomethane to cut CO2 and other emissions. Allow various liquid fuels to be sold and cars developed to run on it going forward to help reduce waste from batteries.
attributes.additional_details:
Alternative fuels use current infrastructure, so more affordable for those on a low income. Making Batteries releases high emissions. Electric cars have impracticalities - long charging, lower range & fast charging leads to shorter battery life & expense.
EVs are heavy, tyres wear faster, more tyre particle dust & road damage.
Some can't charge near home. EVs are too quiet, more accidents!
Human rights & Cobalt mining. Biomethane is more biodiverse and can be made from waste reducing pollution.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you support the uptake of vehicles that use cleaner fuels, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Cars using fuels like those you specify are already legal to own and drive in the UK, and manufacturers are free to develop this technology in the future.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to make grants available for buying or developing cars that use renewable or cleaner fuels, or to exempt these vehicles from the ban on new petrol and diesel cars, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Act on the recommendations in Extinction -The Facts programme
attributes.background: Meet with the experts in the programme Extinction, Professor Lord Nicholas Stern, the ecology experts and use their advice to help rebuild both the economy and the biodiversity of the planet.
attributes.additional_details: We need to change our behaviour, our use of resources and we have never had such an opportunity as now; when the whole world is affected by this pandemic and needs to pull together to change how we all do things. From the top down.

rejection.details:
You say you want the Government to act on recommendations in a particular TV programme but don't specify what these recommendations were or what they relate to.

You may nevertheless wish to sign the following petition which calls for a 'green new deal' to be central to the Government's post-Covid economic recovery plans: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343.

attributes.action: Transition from animal to arable agriculture to protect against climate change.
attributes.background: Encourage farmers in the UK to switch to arable agriculture to facilitate further growth in plant-based lifestyles which will in turn, reduce our carbon emissions in these desperate times.
attributes.additional_details:
Animal agriculture is the second largest contributor to human-made greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions after fossil fuels and is a leading cause of deforestation, water and air pollution and biodiversity loss.

It is vital that we all take a stand and effect change as a matter of urgency, in order to protect our Earth and to ensure a habitable world exists for future generations.

This is supported by Sir David Attenborough.

I was alarmed to see the lack of consideration for this topic at COP26.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you would like to see more farmers moving away from animal farming but it is unclear which policies or areas of the law you would like changed, or what should be introduced to make this happen. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what specific action you would like the Government or Parliament to take.

attributes.action: Clean up UK Oceans and Rivers so we're free to swim and protect ecodiversity
attributes.background: As water users we want to be able to get in the water as much as possible. But not only can we end up covered in raw sewage when it has been discharged, we're at risk of gastroenteritis, ear, nose and throat infections, skin infections, and even hepatitis and e-coli.
attributes.additional_details:
Water quality is also deadly for river and ocean wildlife, reducing biodiversity and causing huge damage to these delicate ecosystems. 

In 2020 alone, there were over 400,000 discharges of untreated sewage into UK rivers and 2,941 discharges into UK coastal bathing waters. 

We won't stand for this any longer.
#EndSewagePollution

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about cleanliness of oceans and waters, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Give the Environment Agency the funds and freedom to protect English rivers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586378

Make it illegal for water companies to dump sewage into rivers and seas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: End the measurement of vehicle emissions as 'tailpipe only' to allow clean fuels
attributes.background: Government must end 'tailpipe only' measure as it doesn't consider other environmental costs such as battery manufacture. Allow sale of electrofuels / efuels & biomethane new cars after 2030 to reduce & reverse CO2 levels. We must reduce Lithium extraction as it is very damaging to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Clean fuels use normal petrol or diesel pumps, no need for environmentally damaging charger installs everywhere.
Battery manufacture creates high co2 emissions, adds cost & Lithium is not renewable!
Charging cars is not practical for lots of people.
Cobalt mining is still using Child Labour.
Biomethane can be CO2 negative full lifecycle.
Biomethane is biodiverse & can be made from waste reducing pollution.
Combustion cars, vans, trucks etc. are more affordable for people or business on a budget.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure for what purposes you'd like other emissions to be measured, for example to calculate vehicle tax. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.  You might also like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563118

attributes.action: Drop GDP as the primary measure of success, adopt Inclusive Wealth instead
attributes.background: Gross Domestic Product has long been the primary yardstick for measuring the welfare of the nation - but it fails to acknowledge the role of nature in supporting the economy. Changing to Inclusive Wealth instead will allow government to re-frame goals, and legislate to encourage sustainable business
attributes.additional_details: The imminent collapse of so many eco-systems globally are an existential threat to civilisation. The Dasgupta Review into the Economics of Biodiversity offers a realistic roadmap of change to avoid this calamity - but requires Government to lead and encourage business into fundamental changes in economic planning, and use of natural resources. The review is explicit - without change we are facing a global crisis.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to change its priorities, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

GDP is one measures if and how much the economy is growing, but it does not have any formal status as the primary measure for success.

You could start a new petition calling for the Government to produce a strategy to increase inclusive wealth, or encourage sustainable business, if that's what you want to happen, but it would need to be clear what actions you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Keep the ban on bee killing pesticides post in the UK
attributes.background: There has been reports on the lifted ban on bee killing pesticides since leaving the EU, this is a promise that has been broken and could have catastrophic impact in securing and encouraging biodiversity and increasing bee populations.
attributes.additional_details: Continue the implemented ban on bee killing pesticides, this will be crucial for bee health, soil health and many other species being lost due to pesticides.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Make the use of Bee killing pesticides in the UK illegal.
attributes.background: A bee-killing poisonous pesticide that it is banned for use in the EU has now been permitted by the UK government to be used by farmers in England. Environment secretary George Eustice has agreed for the pesticide containing the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam to be used to protect sugar beat yields.
attributes.additional_details: The decision to allow farmers to use this pesticide must be reversed as a matter of urgency to protect fragile biodiversity in the UK. The government should be doing everything in its power to protect bees as a result of the biodiversity crisis which states that half the planets insects have disappeared. We are in the midst of a climate emergency and the use of this pesticide will make all efforts to protect wildlife so far futile.   Protecting Bees guarantees the future of our planet.

attributes.action: Give Hedgerows Statutory Legal Protection
attributes.background: Hedgerows are vital wildlife habitats corridors often connecting some of our most important ancient woodlands and wood pastures. For wildlife to maintain migratory routes and their daily foraging territories essential to life we believe they need the same protection as the afore mentioned habitats
attributes.additional_details:
Where intensive agriculture has decimated biodiversity across the countryside hedgerows remain as last refuges for many species of plant, fungi and invertebrate. That could easily be lost forever should these linear mini woodlands be lost or fail to function as they have done for centuries.
In circumstances where hedgerows have to be removed, especially ancient hedgerows, these corridors should be reconnected by hedge planting around the development site.

attributes.action: Protect Aberdeens Greenfern, Northfield against all current & future developers
attributes.background: Greenfern fields are a major part of our cities green belt and cultural heritage & is home to important protected wildlife. I walk there every day & enjoy watching Tawny owls, Bats, Red Kites & Sparrow Hawks & I have noticed signs of Badgers. Please help keep our green belt green & flourishing.
attributes.additional_details: The previous petition was stopped due to a general election, the petition mudt be re-posted. Developing this site means pushing Aberdeen's greenbelt even further out of the City. This site is home to many schedule 1 & 2 protected species which I have seen first hand. The site has high recreational value and is loved by locals, both young and old.  Dog walkers, bird watchers, families etc. love this site and it's part of the Northfield communities cultural heritage. The Council recently contracted Raeburn in for soil testing and further assessment which means the Council are looking to sell this land with such immense biodiversity value, to developers.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter the local authority and the Scottish Parliament.

attributes.action: The PM to address the nation daily via TV on Climate Crisis plans and actions.
attributes.background: To communicate to the nation that we are in the sixth mass extinction, and the need for radical action to stop an existential threat globally through social collapse.  To explain with total urgency what social collapse is: food insecurity; water insecurity; mass death; mass migration; disease; war.
attributes.additional_details: Radical change at scale is screamingly urgent and can only be made to happen by governments across the globe. We have to stop emissions now, plan and act. Science already informs us that if we stopped all emissions immediately we will still face phenomenal human suffering. Therefore it is a moral imperative for governments and the people to take unprecedented, massive actions now to save our planet and life on earth. We are all one and great swathes of biodiversity are going extinct. Next us.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions requesting action by the Government or House of Commons. The actions of individual Ministers, including the Prime Minister, is a matter for them as individuals.

We can also only accept a petition that makes a clear request for action, and while your petition states that radical change is urgent, the only request your petition appears to make is for a daily briefing. We have published the following related petitions, which you might like to sign:

Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

Publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

Make Ecocide a criminal offence in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332264

Support making ECOCIDE an international crime: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320890
